divs: sighting detailsi was letting my dog out at around 10 p.m. we live in a small hilltown area at the foot of the berkshires. i usually look up to see the stars as where we live they can be very bright and pretty as if you could just pluck them out of the sky. anyhow, i noticed one unusaully bright "star" and realized it was glowing in colors. not white like a regular star, but white was one of the alternating colors. we do get plane traffic as we are on the flight path of planes coming from new york to bradley int'l airport in ct. i worked at bdl airport as a police officer for 22 1\2 years so i know what planes look like and whate color lights they normally have. this was not a plane. i then got my binoculars to see if i could see it any closer. the binoculars actually did help me to see the ufo more clearly. it was at that time using the bincoulars that i noticed a secondary smaller ufo that was also stationary and had rotating red lights. the smaller ufo was disc shaped and the larger ufo was diamond shaped. suddenly the smaller red ufo took off fast and was blocked by the tree line. (i was looking out in a south-west direction from my house). i watched the larger ufo which did not move, stayed stationary for over an hour and rotated lights from white to yellow to green to red to blue and sometimes two colors at the same time. the overall outline was white diamond shaped. my husband works the evening shift and was due home and i was hoping he would get home in time to verify what i was seeing so i wouldn't think i was imagining it. he came home at 11:00 p.m. and i immediately showed him it and then he got the binoculars and confirmed everything from the diamond shape to the colors. he said it could be a comet, but i don't think comets stay in one spot for one hour? or rotate in colors? it stayed there and we were tired of looking at it as looking through binculars for a long time gets tiring. it was too far way that i knew my camera would not be able to take a good picture or clear enough picture so i didn't bother. now i wish i tried at least! we watched tv for awhile and i went back out to see if it was still there, but it was gone. this was about 11:20 p.m. i looked for it the next few nights just in case i mistook it for a star or whatever, but it has not been back since.
